refsection.title: Downloading and Installing ProActive Scilab Toolbox and ProActive Scheduler
refsection.para:
Scilab Connector Toolbox can be downloaded from : http://www.activeeon.com/community-downloads
and will be soon available on ATOMS with Scilab 6+ compatibility.
After ProActive Scheduler and ProActive Scilab Connector are downloaded, unzip them in a directory e.g. D:\Scilab_Connector and D:\ProActive_Scheduling_server
According to your deployment infrastructure, ProActive Scheduler must be installed on :

listitem.para: The host which will launch the Scheduler.
Each worker host used by the Scheduler.

refsection.para: The prerequisite for using the ProActive Scheduler is a Java Virtual Machine. On the above list, machines must have a Java Virtual Machine installed and available on the Path of either cmd.exe for Windows or sh for linux. For many ProActive features it is also necessary to define the environment variable JAVA_HOME to the installation directory of the Java Virtual Machine.
Complete configuration and installation of the ProActive Scheduler is beyond the scope of this help, for more information, refer to:
Scilab Connector must be installed on :

listitem.para: Each client host which will connect to the Scheduler to submit Scilab functions.

refsection.title: Automatic search of Scilab installations for workers
refsection.para: In the typical utilisation of the toolbox, no configuration of the worker host will be necessary for Scilab. When a scilab task is waiting to be executed on a scheduler worker, a script will be executed to locate automatically scilab on the host.

The script will search for scilab in typical locations in both windows and linux environments and will write the scilab installations found in a configuration file which will be stored on the host. If no scilab installation is found, then the configuration file will be empty and the host will be assumed not to contain any scilab.

Subsequent executions of Scilab will reuse this configuration file to decide whether a scilab task can be executed on the host or not (though it is possible to force a scilab research via execution options, see option ForceScilabSearch in Configuring PAsolve behavior).

refsection.title: Manual configuration of Scilab installations for workers
refsection.para: It may happen though that on some hosts, Scilab is not installed in a typical location and the automatic script doesn't manage to find it. In that case it will be necessary to write a Scilab configuration file manually.
A sample configuration file is located inside the Scilab_Connector/lib/worker folder under the name ScilabWorkerConfiguration.xml

This file must be edited and put inside the addons directory of ProActive Scheduler on the server side and on every hosts that will be used as Scilab workers for which the automatic configuration didn't work.

If the scheduler is installed in a single directory shared by all workers (via NFS for example), then only one ScilabWorkerConfiguration.xml file needs to be edited. The syntax of the file allows to create a configuration for several machine groups via wildcards that will match a machine's hostname or ipaddress, and as well several scilab installations for the same machine.
Here is an example of ScilabWorkerConfiguration.xml :
refsection.programlisting: <MatSciWorkerConfiguration> <MachineGroup hostname=".*"> <scilab> <version>5.3.0</version> <!-- Scilab version (must be at least 5.3.0) --> <home>c:\Program Files\scilab-5.3.0</home> <!-- Scilab installation directory --> <bindir>bin</bindir> <command>Scilex.exe</command> <arch>32</arch> </scilab> </MachineGroup> </ScilabInstallations>
refsection.para: Here is an explanation of tags used by this file:

listitem.para: MachineGroup: this defines the machines which are targeted by this configuration. Machines can be identified by either hostname orip. The syntax of hostname and ip attributes follow the Regular Expression syntax
version: the Scilab version installed in numeric format.
home: full path to scilab home directory.
bindir: relative path (from homedir) to scilab executable.

refsection.title: Manual Installation of ProActive Scilab Connector Libraries to the ProActive Scheduler
refsection.para: The content of the directory Scilab_Connector/lib/worker (not the directory itself, only the content) must be copied inside the addons directory of ProActive Scheduler and of every Scilab Worker which will be used as matlab workers.
Manually installing the librairies used by Scilab Connector inside the scheduler reduces the overhead of transferring them each time through the network.
